author: Michael Larabel
description: A patch series posted overnight that is part of a larger planned rework for the kernel to introduce a "Swap Table" is poised to bring significant real-world performance gains to the Linux kernel...
title: Linux Primed For Significant Performance Gains With Kernel Swap Code Overhaul

author: Michael Larabel
description: For those that happen to have an HP Victus 16-r1000 gaming laptop or considering one with the 14th Gen Intel Core CPUs and NVIDIA GeForce RTX 40 graphics, the Linux support is now slightly better off thanks to the HP-WMI driver adding fan and thermal profile support for the Victus 16-r1000 series...
title: Linux 6.17 Adds Fan & Thermal Profile Support For HP Victus 16-r1000 Gaming Laptops

author: Michael Larabel
description: Google is preparing a field trial with the Chrome web browser of accelerated video decoding under Wayland/Linux as a step toward rolling it out by default for a better video playback experience on the Linux desktop with Wayland-based environments...
title: Google Prepares Chrome Field Trial For Accelerated Video Decode On Wayland

author: Michael Larabel
description: Nearly a decade after the Tegra X2 SoC shipped in the likes of the Jetson TX2, the Pascal-based GP10B GPU has received a patch for allowing GPU re-clocking within the open-source Nouveau driver...
title: Nouveau Driver Receives Patch For GPU Reclocking With The Pascal GP10B

author: Michael Larabel
description: KDE developer Nate Graham is out with his customary weekend blog post to summarize all the interesting Plasma desktop developments for the week. Most exciting in recent days is Plasma 6.5 receiving an initial system setup wizard...
title: KDE Plasma 6.5 Introducing "KISS" - An Initial System Setup Wizard
